no_description: One of the earliest film genres in existence, the action genre has close ties to classic strife and struggle narratives that you find across all manner of art and literature.

A favorite genre of film audiences young and old, from the very beginning of cinema, the comedy genre has been a fun-loving, quite sophisticated, and innovative genre that is delighted viewers for decades.
While perhaps considered one of the more recent film genres to come into existence, elements of horror have long been a bedrock of classic cinema.
One of the most experimental and thought-provoking of the classic genres, the science-fiction (popularized as “sci-fi”) film genre goes all the way back to the silent film era.
The western could technically be considered a sub-genre of the action film genre, in large part due to its huge popularity and its own exploits. Really, the various sub-genres.
